description: This module assists 2nd and 3rd year students in understanding why media operates the way it does in the real world and looks toward how it is likely to develop in the future. For this, it examines the history, technology and business practices that determine the structure and outputs of media industries (especially, those of Singapore). After being exposed to key theoretical frameworks, students will study the management structures, procedures, policies, and goals of a variety of media operations, including newspapers, magazine, advertising, broadcasting, cable, and online media. For CNM, FASS and SoC students
title: Media Industries and Organisations
